title: Jaguar Land Rover back in profit following surge in China sales
text:
Jaguar Land Rover has boosted sales in China by almost a quarter, helping the car maker return to profitability after a torrid year which has brought thousands of job cuts and a £3.6bn loss.

Worldwide sales at the Coventry-based manufacturer reached £6.1bn in the three months to September, a rise of 8pc on the same period in the previous year.

The company, owned by India’s Tata Motors, reported pre-tax profits of £156m for the quarter against a loss of £90m a year earlier.

“Project Charge” – JLR’s cost-cutting plan – contributed to £162m in cost improvements in the quarter as well as a £285m reduction in investment spending.
